✮ CHARACTER PROFILE: King David

↗ Quick Overview
• Shepherd boy who became Israel's greatest king, known as "a man after God's own heart"
• Warrior, poet, and flawed leader who experienced both triumph and failure
• Lived approximately 1040-970 BC in ancient Israel
• Key verse: 1 Samuel 13:14 - "A man after God's own heart"

↗ Timeline & Key Events
• Young shepherd protecting flocks (1 Samuel 16-17)
• Anointed by Samuel as future king (1 Samuel 16:13)
• Defeated Goliath with faith and a sling (1 Samuel 17)
• Fled from jealous King Saul for years (1 Samuel 18-31)
• Became king of Judah, then all Israel (2 Samuel 1-5)
• Committed adultery with Bathsheba, arranged Uriah's death (2 Samuel 11)
• Faced rebellion from son Absalom (2 Samuel 15-18)
• Final years preparing for Solomon's reign (1 Kings 1-2)

↗ Lessons for Today
• Courage in Crisis: Faced giants with faith, not fear
• Authentic Worship: Wrote honest psalms expressing real emotions
• Consequences Matter: Even forgiven sin has lasting effects
• Genuine Repentance: Took responsibility when confronted with sin
• God's Grace: Despite failures, remained in God's plan

↗ Key Scripture References
• 1 Samuel 13:14 - "A man after God's own heart"
• Psalm 23 - "The Lord is my shepherd"
• Psalm 51 - David's prayer of repentance
• 2 Samuel 7:16 - God's covenant with David
• Acts 13:22 - New Testament reference to David's heart
